[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/traits.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Length mismatch] What happens if the number of ciphertexts and evaluation proofs don't match? Does prepare_cts() fail safely or can it produce partially prepared outputs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/traits.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Decryption key validation] Does decrypt() validate that the decryption_key was properly reconstructed from a threshold of shares, or can a malformed key cause incorrect decryption or information leakage? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/traits.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Prepared ciphertext tampering] Can an attacker modify prepared ciphertexts after prepare_cts() but before decrypt() to cause decryption of wrong plaintexts or bypass security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/traits.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Plaintext type confusion] Can an attacker exploit the generic Plaintext parameter to decrypt data into an incorrect type, causing deserialization failures or type safety violations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/traits.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Partial decryption] If some prepared ciphertexts are invalid, does decrypt() fail completely or return partial results, potentially causing inconsistent state across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/traits.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Decryption order] Does decrypt() return plaintexts in the same order as the input prepared ciphertexts, or can ordering mismatches cause plaintext-ciphertext confusion? (Medium)
